> Having sensed Ragnar's presence long before she heard him, Empath 
> decided the best place to hide was right out in the open.  She knew 
> the Ghost Bear had overheard.  "I don't see what you're complaining 
> about, Maxima." she says.  "They scrapped your old, highly 
> inefficient body in favor of a top-of-the-line model.  I'm quite 
> happy the way I am now.  But, if you really want to find Teletran-
1, 
> be wary.  The Tripredacus forces would gain even more of an 
advantage 
> then they have already if the Ark were destroyed, and they know 
> this.  You must be careful not to lead them to it by accident."

She glanced down. The idea of the Ark destroyed didn't bother her 
much. It was the fact that Megatron would be in danger that did alarm 
her greatly. "I have to try, Empath." Pausing a moment. "I won't risk 
Megatron's termination. Hence why I think that I need to go... to 
protect it. If they were as intelligent as they say they are, then 
they already know the location. All they have to do is go there & 
destroy it." then she thought. "Then again, if they did, there would 
be none of us now. Well, except for you & I since we were not aboard 
the Ark." She felt she had to protect her comrades in stasis on the 
Ark.  

Then she looked up. "As I see it, this transorganic form is weaker 
than my old form. For one... I can't fly." she smirked. She wondered 
if that was a touchy spot for the old Seeker considering if she was 
anything like the other Seekers, flight was the ultimate in freedom & 
conquest.
